intro: Pomatostoma inaequalis, commonly known as the unequal pomatostoma, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and fynbos vegetation. It is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations. The species plays a minor role in local ecosystems but is not considered economically significant.
